page.title: 14HOUSING IN BACKWELL
page.content: The first impression that is given,of the houses on the main road is that they are well maintained , pre war houses with large attractive gardens. It is surprising that so many people want to live on the main roads that run through Backwell, as they are usually busy and the houses are quite expensive. People buy them because they are large ,close to the countryside ,and because the local school has a good reputation . A lot ofthe houses further from the centre are quite new and about half of them have been made by the council.The older houses tend to have larger grounds because the price of ground has gone up during the years . In the newer area people are younger as they can't afford the bigger houses .
